intro: Symphyopappus brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, typical of the family. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The botanical features of Symphyopappus brasiliensis make it an important species for ecological studies in its native region.
